Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.utils

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re
import os
import random
import string
import time
from havoc.lib.decorators import retry



[docs]def regular_exp(self, host, reg_ex, cmd):
    output = host.run(cmd)
    pattern = re.compile(reg_ex, re.MULTILINE | re.DOTALL)
    match = re.search(pattern, output)
    if match:
        return match.group(1)
    else:
        return False




[docs]@retry(tries=6, sleep_seconds=2, exponential=True)
def rsync(host, source, dir_to_copy):
    cmd = "rsync -r %s %s" % (source, dir_to_copy)
    host.run(cmd)
    return os.path.join(dir_to_copy, os.path.basename(source))




[docs]@retry(tries=6, sleep_seconds=2, exponential=True)
def copy_file(host, source_file, dir_to_copy, force=False):
    options = "ar"
    if force:
        options += "f"
    try:
        host.run("/bin/cp -%s %s %s" % (options, source_file, dir_to_copy))
    except Exception:
        pass
    return os.path.join(dir_to_copy, os.path.basename(source_file))




[docs]def gen_random_string(length=24):
    """
    Generate a random string of a provided length (default is 24)
    """
    return ''.join(
        [random.choice(string.ascii_letters + string.digits) for n in range(length)]
    )




[docs]def is_random_string_in_log(log_output, random_str):
    """
    Check if a given string is contained in log
    """
    # for line in log_output.splitlines():
    if re.search(random_str, log_output):
        return True
    return False




[docs]def is_function_in_obj(obj, func_name):
    """
    Return true if a given object has a function with a given name

    @param Object obj
    @param String func_name
    """
    func = getattr(obj, func_name, None)
    if callable(func):
        return True
    return False




[docs]def epoch_to_time_string(form, t):
    """
    Convert an epoch time value to a time string in the format
    provided

    @param String form: format of time string to produce
    @param t int: epoch time
    @return String
    """
    # epoch has to be converted to a struct_time first
    local_t = time.localtime(t)
    return time.strftime(form, local_t)




[docs]def time_str_to_epoch(form, time_str):
    """
    Convert a time string of a format to epoch time

    @param String form: format of time string
    @param String time_str: time string to produce
    @return int
    """
    return int(time.mktime(
        time.strptime(time_str, form)
    ))




[docs]def strip_white_spaces_from_keys(mapping):
    """
    Recursively remove white spaces from key names of a dictionary in place

    @param {} mapping
    """
    for k, v in list(mapping.items()):
        _k = k.strip()
        if _k != k:
            mapping[_k] = v
            del mapping[k]
        if isinstance(v, dict):
            strip_white_spaces_from_keys(v)




[docs]def find_in_nested_dict(nested_dict, key):
    """
    Find a value of a given key in a nested dictionary

    @param {} nested_dict:
    @param string key:
    @return value of key
    """
    value = None
    for k, v in nested_dict.items():
        if k == key:
            return v
        elif isinstance(v, dict):
            value = find_in_nested_dict(v, key)
            if value is not None:
                return value
